page.title: 08WICKHAMBROOK CHURCH AREA
page.content: The Church dates from the 12th century. It is well preserved and well kept, with a congregation of about 50 on Sunday (Family Eucharist). A small Parish Room is next door and this is used not only for Church events but for Parish Council Meetings. The Old Vicarage is now a private house and the Vicar lives in a modern vicarage. Two Almshouses provided by Thomas Sparrow are still lived in. The building is well thatched with Norfolk Reed. Originally the Trust stated that 12 people should live in this accommodation. The White House, now a Doctor's home, was formerly a pub. Along the road towards the A143 is the Manor House which has fine chimneys.
